item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Colorado Rep. Leslie Herod, a Democrat, told ABC News that her colleagues on both sides of the aisle wanted to address the public's concerns.

We had letters from across Colorado, emails from across Colorado. Republicans say, 'I'm getting e-mails on this thing. Let's make this workable. You know, I want to vote 'yes.' Get me [too],'" she told ABC News."

item.title: "Too many Coloradans have been followed their entire lives...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Too many Coloradans have been followed their entire lives by a conviction for something that is no longer a crime, and these convictions have impacted their job status, housing, and countless other areas of their lives," the governor explained. "Today we are taking this step toward creating a more just system and breaking down barriers to help transform people‚Äôs lives as well as coming to terms with one aspect of the past, failed policy of marijuana prohibition.‚Äù

Colorado Politics

The pardons, granted through executive order, are the result of House Bill 1424, which authorizes the governor to grant pardons for those convicted of possessing up to two ounces of

coloradopolitics.com

Gov. Jared Polis pardons 2,732 convictions for low-level marijuana possession

The pardons, granted through executive order, are the result of House Bill 1424, which authorizes the governor to grant pardons for those convicted of possessing up to two ounces ofThe pardons, granted through executive order, are the result of House Bill 1424, which authorizes the governor to grant pardons for those convicted of possessing up to two ounces of

item.title: Some folks didn‚Äôt even know this happened. But, in the final...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Some folks didn‚Äôt even know this happened. But, in the final hours of the legislative session, Representatives Coleman, Singer and I joined forces to make real change for 2,700 Coloradans. Thank you Governor Jared Polis for exercising your new power to its fullest extent. And thank you Speaker Becker for allowing the amendment to move forward.

Colorado Gov. Jared Polis plans to mass-pardon 2,732 convictions of marijuana possession through an executive order Thursday after signing a bill earlier this year that gave him that authority.

denverpost.com

Colorado governor to mass-pardon 2,700-plus marijuana convictions

Colorado Gov. Jared Polis plans to mass-pardon 2,732 convictions of marijuana possession through an executive order Thursday after signing a bill earlier this year that gave him that authority.Colorado Gov. Jared Polis plans to mass-pardon 2,732 convictions of marijuana possession through an executive order Thursday after signing a bill earlier this year that gave him that authority.

item.title: Y'all. Voting in CO is amazing and everyone should have this option. I get time to review my ballot, talk it over with the kids, demystify the voting process, research the judges and ballot initiatives, and do it all in comfy pants. I track my ballot online & feel safe & secure. twitter.com/leslieherod/st‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Y'all. Voting in CO is amazing and everyone should have this option. I get time to review my ballot, talk it over with the kids, demystify the voting process, research the judges and ballot initiatives, and do it all in comfy pants. I track my ballot online & feel safe & secure. twitter.com/leslieherod/st‚Ä¶
Thanks to @JenaGriswold and the county clerks of Colorado, our voting system is safe, secure and verifiable. PASS IT ON.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúSensing an opportunity in this turbo-charged election,...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúSensing an opportunity in this turbo-charged election, progressives are pouring significant resources into their effort: The Sixteen Thirty Fund, a national dark money nonprofit, has given nearly $3 million to the campaign itself. But the ballot initiative could be a risk for reformers too: An election loss would make it more difficult to try again at the capitol.‚Äù

The Colorado Sun

Lawmakers have rejected it six times. Now, Proposition 118 could make Colorado the ninth state in the country to mandate paid family leave ‚Äî or set the effort back even further.

cpr.org

After Years Of Statehouse Debate, Colorado Voters Face Historic Decision On Paid Family Leave

Lawmakers have rejected it six times. Now, Proposition 118 could make Colorado the ninth state in the country to mandate paid family leave ‚Äî or set the effort back even further.Lawmakers have rejected it six times. Now, Proposition 118 could make Colorado the ninth state in the country to mandate paid family leave ‚Äî or set the effort back even further.

item.title: ‚ÄúThe important thing when it comes to releasing is right, not...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThe important thing when it comes to releasing is right, not fast,‚Äù Sarah Tuneberg, Polis‚Äô coronavirus innovation response team lead, said in a written statement. ‚ÄúWe want to make sure that everything is in place to make the launch as smooth and as seamless as possible.‚Äù

The Colorado Sun

State officials initially said the ‚ÄúExposure Notifications Express‚Äù system would go live before the end of September

coloradosun.com

item.title: Last night, President Trump not only refused to denounce white...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Last night, President Trump not only refused to denounce white supremacy, but used the debate stage to put out a signal to ‚Äúthe Proud Boys‚Äù, a right-wing extremist group, to ‚Äústand back and stand by‚Äù. Stand by for what? Let‚Äôs be clear about one thing - this is a threat aimed at the American people. This should never be said by a president and never said on a debate stage. FOX21 News
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: . @realdonaldtrump YOU REFUSED to condemn white supremacy last night. I #pledge to stand against white supremacy and I call on all leaders holding public office, Democrat and Republican, to do the same #SilenceIsComplicity
item.content:encoded: . @realdonaldtrump YOU REFUSED to condemn white supremacy last night. I #pledge to stand against white supremacy and I call on all leaders holding public office, Democrat and Republican, to do the same #SilenceIsComplicity

item.title: As President Reagan once said, ‚Äúthe orderly transfer of authority as called for in the Constitution routinely takes place, as it has for almost 2 centuries, and few of us stop to think how unique we really are.‚Äù Congress must protect the peaceful transfer of power. And we will. pic.twitter.com/btxvkST4qT
item.content:encoded: As President Reagan once said, ‚Äúthe orderly transfer of authority as called for in the Constitution routinely takes place, as it has for almost 2 centuries, and few of us stop to think how unique we really are.‚Äù Congress must protect the peaceful transfer of power. item.title: I am so honored to be named Emerge Colorado's trailblazer...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

I am so honored to be named Emerge Colorado's trailblazer of the year! Purchase your tickets today (https://rb.gy/oedvk7) and join us Thursday, October 15th, for the celebration.

Our annual Trailblazers Reception brings together supporters, our alumnae, elected officials, business leaders, and political professionals from across the state to celebrate women's political leadership in Colorado and look ahead to all that we will be able to accomplish in 2020 and beyond.

secure.everyaction.com

Emerge Colorado's 2020 Annual Trailblazers Reception

Our annual Trailblazers Reception brings together supporters, our alumnae, elected officials, business leaders, and political professionals from across the state to celebrate women's political leadership in Colorado and look ahead to all that we will be able to accomplish in 2020 and beyond.Our annual Trailblazers Reception brings together supporters, our alumnae, elected officials, business leaders, and political professionals from across the state to celebrate women's political leadership in Colorado and look ahead to all that we will be able to accomplish in 2020 and beyond.

item.title: "A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters ‚Äî especially younger ones ‚Äî to cure, or fix, the problem, Griswold told The Denver Post. Voters will be notified of discrepancies by mail, as usual. But now they‚Äôll have a route other than the U.S. Postal Service to fix the problem."

The Denver Post

A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters ‚Äî especially younger ones ‚Äî to cure, or fix, problematic ballots.

denverpost.com

Colorado voters will be able to fix their ballot problems via text, Secretary of State says

item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúDenver Elections anticipates such a busy election, it went...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúDenver Elections anticipates such a busy election, it went out and found new places for people to cast their ballot.

A release from Denver Elections on Tuesday said it will move operations from its main office vote center, on 14th Avenue, down a block to the McNichols Building in Civic Center Park ‚Äúso that the entire Denver Elections building can be utilized for ballot processing.‚Äù The move was prompted as the office anticipates high voter turnout and because this year‚Äôs ballot includes three double-sided cards. The McNichols offices, at 144 W. Colfax Ave., will open Oct. 12.‚Äù

Denverite

For the first time ever, you‚Äôll be able to cast a ballot at the Pepsi Center. The city will have 36 voting centers.

denverite.com

Denver Elections adds vote centers ‚Äî including the Pepsi Center ‚Äî as it anticipates high turnout

For the first time ever, you‚Äôll be able to cast a ballot at the Pepsi Center. The city will have 36 voting centers.For the first time ever, you‚Äôll be able to cast a ballot at the Pepsi Center. The city will have 36 voting centers.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúUnder the law, individuals convicted of felonies can vote as...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúUnder the law, individuals convicted of felonies can vote as soon as they are released from prison, even if they have not yet paid all their fines or restitution. This applies to those on parole, who must meet a series of conditions before completing their sentence.

‚ÄúWe are always intentional about letting people know their rights because incarceration has disproportionately impacted communities of color and particularly Black communities,‚Äù Lytle said. ‚Äú

The Colorado Sun

The law allows those convicted of felonies who are out on parole to vote. People convicted of misdemeanors or awaiting trial have long been able to vote.

coloradosun.com

Colorado parolees are now allowed to vote. And advocates are rushing to register them.

The law allows those convicted of felonies who are out on parole to vote. People convicted of misdemeanors or awaiting trial have long been able to vote.The law allows those convicted of felonies who are out on parole to vote. People convicted of misdemeanors or awaiting trial have long been able to vote.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs so exciting about this moment is that we are...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs so exciting about this moment is that we are recognizing that racism is indeed institutional and structural,‚Äù activist and scholar Angela Davis explained in a recent interview. ‚ÄúIt is embedded in the very fabric of this country, and we‚Äôre trying to figure out ways to begin to initiate the process of eliminating that racism.‚Äù To understand just how deeply racism is embedded in our systems, all you have to do is examine any Black community.‚Äù

Essence

Leaders must commit to ensuring that the federal government proactively works to ensure all of its actions are anti-racist and produce equitable outcomes.

essence.com

To Overcome Structural Racism, We Must Create An Anti-Racist Government

Leaders must commit to ensuring that the federal government proactively works to ensure all of its actions are anti-racist and produce equitable outcomes.Leaders must commit to ensuring that the federal government proactively works to ensure all of its actions are anti-racist and produce equitable outcomes.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúCigarettes and tobacco products are taxed in Colorado. Vaping...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúCigarettes and tobacco products are taxed in Colorado. Vaping devices and vaping fuel are not.

A question on the November ballot ‚Äî Proposition EE ‚Äî would change that system, increasing the price of cigarettes and all other nicotine and tobacco products gradually over the next seven years‚Äù

The Colorado Sun

The ballot initiative would require cigarettes to be sold for no less than $7 starting in January. By July 2027, nicotine products would be taxed at 62% of their market list price.

coloradosun.com

Proposition EE explained: How much more cigarettes, nicotine products would cost in Colorado

The ballot initiative would require cigarettes to be sold for no less than $7 starting in January. By July 2027, nicotine products would be taxed at 62% of their market list price.The ballot initiative would require cigarettes to be sold for no less than $7 starting in January. By July 2027, nicotine products would be taxed at 62% of their market list price.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúGradually, however, the use of medication abortion has...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúGradually, however, the use of medication abortion has expanded. According to the most recent data, about 40% of all abortions in the United States are by this method. Some 17 states permit Advanced Practice Clinicians (nurse practitioners, midwives and physician assistants) to provide medication abortion, and this has particularly benefitted rural women. Simultaneously, however, from 2000 on, red state legislators have sought in numerous ways to restrict this method. Seventeen states, for example, prohibit the use of telehealth for medication abortion, though this has been very successful where allowed.‚Äù

TIME

Twenty years after it was approved in the U.S. medication abortion is finally becoming more widely used thanks to the COVID-19 pandemic.

time.com

A Rare Expansion in Abortion Access Because of COVID-19

Twenty years after it was approved in the U.S. medication abortion is finally becoming more widely used thanks to the COVID-19 pandemic.Twenty years after it was approved in the U.S. medication abortion is finally becoming more widely used thanks to the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúDPS has said that the earliest schools will resume in-person...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúDPS has said that the earliest schools will resume in-person learning is October 18, but as parents well know, the district‚Äôs projections keep changing. For many, returning to in-school learning is unlikely due to health concerns or fear about the district‚Äôs capacity to keep their children safe. For others, hope for face-to-face learning is mixed with anxiety as families await information on DPS protocols, class sizes, and other guidelines.‚Äù

What may be the long term implications of pods on public education? In the long term, could it lead to middle class and wealthier parents' divestment from public schools?

frontporchne.com

Getting by with pods‚Äîbut what is the long term cost? | Front Porch

What may be the long term implications of pods on public education? In the long term, could it lead to middle class and wealthier parents' divestment from public schools?What may be the long term implications of pods on public education? In the long term, could it lead to middle class and wealthier parents' divestment from public schools?
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúArtists and volunteers in Denver started a community mural on...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúArtists and volunteers in Denver started a community mural on Sunday in honor of the late-Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. History Colorado is inviting Coloradans to commemorate her legacy during the three-day event.‚Äù

Cbs4 denver

Artists and volunteers in Denver started a community mural on Sunday in honor of the late-Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Volunteers Invited To Honor Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg Outside History Colorado Museum

Artists and volunteers in Denver started a community mural on Sunday in honor of the late-Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.Artists and volunteers in Denver started a community mural on Sunday in honor of the late-Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

item.title: We did it! Today @GovofCO signed the #SB217 the Colorado Law Enforcement Accountability and Integrity Act into law! I can‚Äôt say it enough, this would not have been possible without YOU. PROTESTS = POLICY CHANGE. #blacklivesmatter pic.twitter.com/dsxBG9bbvq
item.content:encoded: We did it! Today @GovofCO signed the #SB217 the Colorado Law Enforcement Accountability and Integrity Act into law! I can‚Äôt say it enough, this would not have been possible without YOU. PROTESTS = POLICY CHANGE. #blacklivesmatter pic.twitter.com/dsxBG9bbvq
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.
